explanation: Worksheet is grid of cells - rows (numbers) and columns (letters).
B5 = Column B, Row 5. Column letter first, then row number.
$A$1 stays fixed when copied. $A1 fixes column; A$1 fixes row.
MIN returns smallest number in range. MAX returns largest.
COUNTIF(range, criteria) counts cells that meet condition.
SUMIF adds cells that meet specified condition.
Paste Special - paste values only, formats, transpose, etc.
Freeze Panes keeps header rows/columns visible while scrolling.
Filter hides rows that don't match criteria. Data not deleted.
Charts visualize data - bar, line, pie, scatter. Easier to understand.

prompt: Mail Merge in Word is used for?
answers: Merging document with data - letters, labels
explanation: Mail Merge combines template with database - bulk letters, labels.

prompt: Header and Footer in Word appear?
answers: Top and bottom of every page
explanation: Header (top), Footer (bottom) - page numbers, document title.
Track Changes marks insertions, deletions. Review and accept/reject.
Watermark - faded text (Draft, Confidential) behind main content.

answers: Layout and design of all slides
explanation: Slide Master defines default layout, fonts, placeholders for all slides.
Transition - effect when moving from one slide to next.
Animation - movement/effect for objects. Entrance, emphasis, exit.

answers: Speaker notes and next slide to presenter
explanation: Presenter view - notes, next slide, timer for presenter. Audience sees slides.
Primary key uniquely identifies each row. No duplicates. E.g., ID.

answers: References primary key of another table
explanation: Foreign key links tables. References primary key of related table.
Query requests data - SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE. SQL used.
SELECT retrieves data. SELECT * FROM table WHERE condition.
WHERE filters rows. SELECT * FROM users WHERE age > 18.
ORDER BY sorts - ASC or DESC. ORDER BY name ASC.
GROUP BY groups rows. Used with COUNT, SUM, AVG. E.g., group by category.
